results.title: Epaves
results.brief_description: Shows the underwater life that is discovered during a trip 130 feet below the surface of the sea when exploring shipwrecks near Toulon in the Mediterranean sea. Two deep-sea divers, equipped with special cameras and other equipment, record the lively activity that takes place among the fish and undersea flora and fauna as the men inspect the shipwrecks.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.

results.title: Environment in the balance
results.brief_description: Shows how geological, topographical and social developments in Britain have helped to shape its present environment and discusses the problems of industrial expansion, population growth and pollution.

results.title: Environment 1990
results.creator_credit: Hugh Macdonald, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Entropy: a measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe (AIE, Module one)
results.creator_credit: Claire Spoelstra, Daniel Riddle, Jason Keen, Kai Faigenbaum, Paul Spence and Academy of Interactive Entertainment (AIE)
results.brief_description:
An exercise in exploring the concept of ‘entropy’ by a group of 5 students has resulted in 5 comic, high quality 3D animations.
The works are: Potato feelings (Daniel Riddle), Mad damn cow (Kai Faigenbaum), Letting go (Claire Spoelstra), Train of thought (Jason Keen), Allsorts (Paul Spence)
results.title_for_label: Entropy: a measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe (AIE, Module one)

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance

group_siblings.title: The Second law of thermodynamics (TEFC)
group_siblings.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Millbank Films

results.title: Entropy
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure, bonding and the periodic law”
Professor L.J. Haynes and Dr R.A. Ross, assisted by Mr R. Andon of the National Physical Laboratory discuss experiments relating to the transfer of energy, illustrating the laws of thermodynamics and the concept of entropy.

results.title: Entombed warriors
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the partially excavated ‘Terracotta Army’ found at Xian in China. Explores the excavation techniques and the historical significance of the find.

results.title: Enthronement of the Archbishop of York
results.brief_description: Some of the recordings made at the enthronement of Archbishop Coggan in York Minster from the arrival of the Archbishop through to his installation and enthronement. Some explanation of cathedral traditions is given in the commentary.
